website_summaries.verdict: Program this pint-sized robotic ball for your own version of fun once you're done with its built-in games and moves.
pros: Ping-pong ball-size version of larger, pricier robot ball
Equipped for simple coding commands, or you can program it using JavaScript once you download the educational app
Pre-programmed for driving through obstacle course and playing basic games

customer_reviews.title: Kids love the miniSphero
customer_reviews.text: as written by the 10 year old who uses Sphero mini: Sphero mini is an evolutionary device for the whole family. The perfect size makes it easily transportable for on the go fun! From the fun of building courses and playing “hide and seek” possibilities are endless. It’s not only a toy but it’s a game! I love the different ways you can control it; tilt, slingshot, face drive, and much more! I have an original Sphere, too. this one is similar, but a whole lot different. Mini seems faster and quicker. Also, the LED inside Sphero-mini is cool. Sphero mini is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: soundmind

customer_reviews.title: Solid company but wait for 2.0 (mini)
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo excited to get this little guy. I used it once. I bought it the day it was released but my carpet is too much for the Sphero mini to move. I love the idea and it seems pretty solid but just like the first Sphero ball they made, the 2.0 was much better (power, speed, control, etc). So my advice is to keep supporting this company because they are doing great things. I hope their price points remain affordable because these toys are still "toys" If money is tight and you are considering your options then wait for 2.0 mini
customer_reviews.author: Ron Nutt 2

customer_reviews.title: Great for middle school
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these for my middle school tech class and the students are really getting a kick out of them. They are making obstacle courses to race them. The minis work well with the Sphero Edu app and my students are enjoying learning the difference between driving and coding. They are pretty small, which is fine, because I don't have much storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Corkig

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Sphero and I can honestly say that I had the most fun with this product. The mini games it provides in the app as well as the portability make this a fantastic toy for pass time. I bring it to my classes and when my professors are inevitably late I bring it out and pass the time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Mini with some extras
customer_reviews.text: While we did love the activity kit, it’s not necessary. My kids got one activity kit and one soccer kit. They share the contents of the activity kit. If you’re on the fence, you can just get the regular mini and use items around your house to make the obstacle courses. They’re fun, but not worth the price jump in my opinion. Also, I recommend downloading the Sphero edu app first. The kids can actually code with it. The play app is fun but not for long. My kids got tired of it quickly but didn’t want to do the “work” of the coding once they saw the play app.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Lucy loves it
customer_reviews.text: One of our dog’s favorite toys. Pros: pretty long battery life, you can start it using the app even I’d you are pretty far away, works great on flat surfaces, you can change the LED color, is fun for us and the dog. Cons: the exterior shell snaps together (our dog can easily break it apart [I understand this was not designed as a dog toy, though]), you must remove the shell to charge it. The cons are minor, but if a rubber cover we're available, that would solve the problem of Lucy breaking it apart. I've seen the request from others who own this, too. Overall, a fun little robot.
customer_reviews.author: TimTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Stated Dimensions are Inacurate
customer_reviews.text: The description says: "Product Dimensions (in inches): 5.5 x 2.25 x 2.25" Wrong. It's about the size of a ping pong ball.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for young and not so young!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I have to confess I originally bought one of these for my son and it was just too much fun not to get one for myself as well. The sphero mini mini balls are about the size of a ping-pong ball that you can control with your phone. It is fun to drive it around, race two of them, and crash them into one another or into other objects such as the included bowling pins.
customer_reviews.author: shopRAVE

customer_reviews.title: Calibration easy to lose
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Really wanted to use this as a toy with my felines. Unfortunately, it becomes uncalibrated (the position of the bot inside the shell) very easily. Just the act of going from hard floor to carpet can do that. If one of my cats "paw" at it...forget it. Uncalibrated. I suppose a"reader" on the inside bot to read laser etched encoding on the surface of the inside shell might have it constantly auto calibrate...but for anything more than a curiosity oddity it's not much use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it. Cat is mesmerized. Has trouble with thicker/shag-like carpet though.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect via Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my son's birthday when it was on sale and the return window closed before I could give it to him. the little thing will not connect to any device via bluetooth. DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Should be $10 and no more!
customer_reviews.text: Way to expensive for what it is. No, it’s not durable. Battery lasts about 30 maybe 40 mins. This items should be $10. Yes, it’s fun, but you gotta recharge every 30-40 mins for an hour. I’m not pleased what so ever. I wouldn’t gift this mini Sphero, maybe a diff one. Very upsetting for the person I gifted it too. Very aggravating toy, very!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Amuses pets, kids, and adults.
customer_reviews.text: Its sort of a silly little robot. It could have more features or stronger motors, but can't beat the price. Its great with kids and even older adults. It amuses them and they aren't sure what to make of it at first. I also used it to play with my dogs. They were scared of it at first and had fun running around playing tag with it. But unfortunately they lost their fear and became a little too aggressive with it, so I dont plan to play with them and it in the future. Maybe a bigger Sphero and a protective case could work. It might be a better toy with cats rather than dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Mossburg

customer_reviews.title: Not for cats
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to control the ball. Our cats wanted to play with it however the remote control on the cell phone is not practical. The ball either moves too fast or too slow. And a little jerky at times if wanted to change the route. It also splits open in half if it bumps to a hard surface fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ozge Cenberci

customer_reviews.title: Who would have known.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an adult grab bag Christmas gift. I was at a loss when this item caught my eye. I purchased it but shortly after had buyer's remorse. Just because I would get a kick out of something like this doesn't mean a real adult would. Not to worry! The person receiving the gift was fascinated with it. It was easy to program and play with wight out of the box. I guess everyone likes to get a toy at Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Huelstrunk

customer_reviews.title: Different but good gift for 7-8 year old girl
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 7 year old daughter's birthday. She'd played with something similar last year at camp so she was very excited when she saw it. It was a shame that I couldn't use the app on her kindle fire because freetime blocks location services and this app requires it. So I installed it on my old android phone and it worked perfectly. It does frequently lose calibration but I have not found it annoying yet.
customer_reviews.author: HEK

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as described.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this item. I wanted to love it but I could not. The ball is supposed to go to sleep when you exit the app. It does not. It turns off completely, meaning you have to take the ball apart and plug it into a UBS power supply to turn it back on. Every time. Support needed a video to even attempt to help me. Sorry but I am using my phone (aka my video camera) to try and use the ball how can I also use it to take the video? I never did get ANY help from them and wound up returning the toy.
customer_reviews.author: All Around Geek

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly; no product support
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 1st use. After providing much details to Sphero directly (barcodes, receipt email, etc). They said they couldn’t help and sent me back to Amazon. Amazon product support loops back to Sphero. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot run stored programs independently; must be constantly connected to phone/tablet
customer_reviews.text: The Sphero mini (and perhaps all of them?) are not able to actually store and run your programs independently but rely on constant communication with the app on your phone or tablet. This seems to cause frequent failures to trigger code that was supposed to run from some event or another even when the phone is only a couple feet away. Probably my expectations were raised too high by the storage capabilities of devices such as Adafruit's Circuit Express [B0764NQ1WW], but it's more challenging to teach and enjoy programming when students' code might or might not actually execute.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: A very expensive uncontrollable toy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in hope of bring the kittens some fun while make them exercise. The shell falls apart very easily, and the connection often drops between the phone and the toy. Charging takes a long time. Simply a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: There is an internal ball that spins in the shell. Within a few seconds it is out of sync. It won't spin much on tight weave carpet. Not talking shag here....daughter lost interest in it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Works great. We are a little disapointed that it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We are a little disapointed that it doesn't run all Sphero apps but I knew it might not. There are lots of apps that do work with it. It was very difficult to tell from the product information from the Sphero company. The face control is over-rated but we expected that also. Who wants to control a ball with your face? It is great for programming just like the Sphero. The seller was great and the product arrived in good repair.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Leming

customer_reviews.title: Still finding new ways to program it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for her 13th birthday and she's still finding new things to program it to do a couple of months later. She had asked for it specifically and I was worried that the novelty would wear off, but I didn't realize the extent of what all it can do. She's having fun with it and learning about coding.
customer_reviews.author: salamanda76

customer_reviews.title: so cool
customer_reviews.text: this little guy is soooo cool! i got it for my 6yr old son who loves everything robot and coding! super easy to use! we use it on a ipad and works great. If you dont want to use the "coding" option you can use your finger to draw where the robot goes! my favorite feature is after you put in what you want it to do it shows you in real time what part is done so far. Also cool features are that you can change the light colors per each direction you want, you can also add sound effects per each movement!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Marie

customer_reviews.title: My dog and cat love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I chase my dog and cat with this, they chase it back, we have a good time for 20 or 30 min as long as the dog doesn't try to pick it up. I am pretty sure that even the cocker spaniel could bite right through the solid plastic shell. Also, every time they bat it or kick it I have to fix the orientation. I am not very quick at this and recognizing it has happened and so it is not big issue. Still, the lazer pointer is much easier but not nearly as fun. This is a fun toy that was well worth the money to entertainment time ratio that I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Campos

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: A big hit! My daughter is 10 and first test drove a Sphero bot at the Franklin Institute in Philly. She immediately added it to her Christmas list. Once we got the app downloaded she dove right into the remote driving and coding games. She has already put hours into this thing and she's only had it 3 days. Charges quickly and holds it's charge well. The only complaint is that there are no instructions in the package. Do yourself a favor and get a case for it that fits the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Melrose

customer_reviews.title: Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My kids saw this at the Apple store and seemed impressed. My sister bought it for my son for his birthday. I assumed they would play with it for a little while and end up collecting dust like the remote control cars they have. This one did not disappoint. It’s actually really cool with the different options it has. My cat also enjoyed chasing it around. It made its way over carpet too which is pretty cool since it’s so small!
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Boy was super happy!!
customer_reviews.text: My son who just turned 11 is taking a Robotics class afterschool this year and fell in love with the Sphero Mini they use and asked for his own. He is super thrilled to have his very own and showed me how it works!! I try to keep my kids off the electronics but who are we kidding. Electronics is their world now and having things like this that are more educational helps!!! Cannot wait for him to start trying out with coding.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf2Boys

customer_reviews.title: Stopped turning on/charging after 6 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a week ago. Driving it is not easy, but it’s pretty fun. Unfortunately it has a hard time climbing small obstacles and it doesn’t seem like there are accessory shells made of different materials like rubber which would be nice. On the 6th day of owning this, it no longer charges or turns on
customer_reviews.author: that dude

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: I really like this as a gift. You kind of have to calibrate it so that the ball goes in the correct direction when you are playing with it. But over all, this is a really cool toy to have. You can change the colors, and have a couple of different games to play. There are different kinds of control options for driving the Sphero. My 7 year old son does think its pretty cool and he appreciates the present
customer_reviews.author: Ki

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy - kind of
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, well made product, but it’s just a little above what I would consider the cheaply made Chinese products very similar to this. Bought for my son for Christmas and it will likely end up in the pile of stuff we don’t use much. The interactivity of the app is about the only cool part of this toy, but it has a good thought. Could be great, but it’s not
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Sphero has jumped the shark
customer_reviews.text: So .. this device is like a little bigger than a golf ball. And you twist it to charge it. I mean, you twist the actual ball itself and it pops out of its shell. This thing is NOT sturdy. You may find yourself taping it back together after the 4th charge. Aside of that, the controls are, of course, phone based. Which means damn near no control. This is basically a $50 golfball you need to charge often, will break easily, and relies on your phone to 'control. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: Really smoothly driven
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy!!!! It is really fun and smoothly driven. It does make a little rattle sound but that is ok for me. This product is very nice to drive has a good protective shell and is super fast!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Watters

customer_reviews.title: Great toy and definitely a learning tool
customer_reviews.text: We love the Sphero! My son is 6 and has learned it and challenges himself with the cards provided. Some things are more difficult than others but as he continues to learn to read he figures out more and more on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Da flip side!!

customer_reviews.title: Just pure silly fun it is.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it just to play around with and harass and exercise the cats. Mixed results. One doesn't care, kitten is curious and baps at it as does one or two of the older 'girls'. Good fun no matter what; even if I'm just driving it around the house for grins and giggles.
customer_reviews.author: Rich K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome motorized, app-controlled
customer_reviews.text: Awesome motorized, app-controlled, robot ball. Works surprisingly well on carpet. My kids have off-brand Android phones and have no problems connecting to and controlling the sphero mini. Great balance between fun and learning. Has an educational app that allows kids to learn how to set command strings to ball, which can later be viewed as code. Great introduction to code and computing concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift that takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these in different colors for grandkids at Christmas, ages 10 & 8, boy & girl. A big hit! I liked them because they were a quality, educational and entertaining "toy" and they don't take up much space. Kids play with them for hours. Easy to store and to pack up to take to Grandmas.
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than the original
customer_reviews.text: This should be given in the name, it is the Sphero Mini. ITs about the size of a golf ball. This makes it easier to use in small places indoors, but doesn't have all of the attachments and such that you can find for the original. For a fun game pick up one of the miniature desktop bowling kits also available on Amazon. The size ration between the Sphero and the pins isn't perfect, but its still fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gehret

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and it has a mode that allows you to ...
customer_reviews.text: DUDE. Get this little thing! So much fun and it has a mode that allows you to play without a phone or app, and my one year old daughter loves chasing it around and catching it, then setting it free and repeating the process. Compatible with Sphero Edu and is good for learning coding. It’s also fun the chase your cat with.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Grey

customer_reviews.title: Good robot, wish there was better instruction.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool for a basic robot. I wish there was a little more walkthrough for onboarding with it. Tutorials on how to code with the edu software. There are a bunch of free videos on the sphero site but it's just not laid out in a friendly way.
customer_reviews.author: tech dad

customer_reviews.title: Crazy fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 year old grandaughter, and she has been having a blast with it. It's totally easy to get started, and the device is really intuitive. The makers have made everything super-easy for the user, as the app and pairing with the device all work easily. It's a brilliant piece of design, and while technology fans will love it, kids who just want to have fun will love it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Name

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: My cat and I both love this thing! I really enjoy the Sphero Edu app. This is definitely a toy/tool to explore and utilize to it’s fullest potential. Probably the best $50 I’ve spent on myself in a long time. By the way, I have had no issues with indoor terrain. It rolls right over carpets, rugs, hard wood floors, floor vents, and even some doorways (if you’re at full speed). Very fast shipping from Amazon and the manufacturer. Accessories ordered from Sphero have free shipping in the US, I ordered the plain white shell. Total winner all around. Great gift for any geek!
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: The cats love chasing it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mini for the sole purpose of messing with the cats. It is about the size of a ping pong ball and the cats are very familiar with those. The cats aren't trying to murder it, but they do love to chase it. The Mini kind of freaks them out when it chases them back... they leap straight up in the air!
customer_reviews.author: Digital Pat

customer_reviews.title: Total hit at our house, no matter the age!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (7 years old) got this for her birthday, and it has been a total hit at our house with all of my kids (5 & 3), regardless of age! We haven’t had any problems with quality. Such a fun toy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: OMG My dog LOVES this!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes crazy for this toy! The only problem is that he wants to catch it in his mouth, carry it back to his lair and chew on it. We need to get a new outer covering. If you can keep it away from it, it is his favorite activity and gives him good exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning Stem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a christmas present for children the age of 10 and 12. They are learning about STEM in school and they just love it. This exceeds my expectations for everything it does. Not only can they use my cell phone to control it then can use their own computers to control it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Neat little toy!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 13 yo for Christmas. He was excited about it for about a day and has barely touched it since. His younger siblings find it much more interesting but they aren’t sure how to make it do much. It does exactly what it says it does though and it seems quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ChaoticEight

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loved this for about 2 weeks and maybe he'll pick it up again later after he gets tired of his other Christmas gifts but it was a pretty good 2 weeks. He spent enough time "programming" the sphero that I think it was probably money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Damuri

customer_reviews.title: Fun cat toy.
customer_reviews.text: Cute little toy. Works like it says. Got this for my cats to play with. They enjoy chasing it around. Sometimes the cap (one side of the ball) falls off fairly easily especially when the cats decide to bat at it. For the price, this isn’t an issue. Overall, it’s a fun interactive toy for your furry friends.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Very cool little robot
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 10. We got her this for Christmas. She uses the app with an old android phone and it works great! The app includes different games she can interact with the robot to play. She can customize the color of the light. We have to use it in a room without the dogs who love playing ball! It’s fun and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: shop4aday

customer_reviews.title: Spins inside case, goes nowhere.
customer_reviews.text: After charging the mini, it was not discoverable on my iPhone. It did connect to the EDU app but the device just spins inside the shell. Hardwood or carpet, it goes nowhere. This was a waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cuz I was bored. Total impulse buy. Thought it would a be fun toy to play with the cats. They still have more fun with a tape measure or cardboard box but sometimes I get them to run after it... or from it. I usually just drive it around on the my desk for a few minutes as a work break.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Strausser

customer_reviews.title: Great toy.  Pre-charge before gifting.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Kids love it. Younger ones may have trouble getting it work right away. Big issue is that it doesn’t come charged. You tell a 6yr old their new “robot” needs to charge for an hour before they can use it. Have fun with that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Liebman

customer_reviews.title: So much fun in something so small.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 sets for my kids for Christmas. They love them. They enjoy the different games and the coding. They enjoy making obstacles. Time will tell how they hold up. Purchased a case for protection and keeping things together.
customer_reviews.author: Renee M

customer_reviews.title: Not good on thick carpet.....
customer_reviews.text: We have thicker open pile carpet in the one area of the home this was intended for and it will not move much at all. Good for hardwood floors and maybe non shag floors. Get the full size version instead for use on plush floors.
customer_reviews.author: Goody

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a green Sphero Mini, but received an orange one. It's a birthday present for my son, who's birthday is tomorrow. He wanted a green one. The box is also covered with some sort of stickiness. I'm sure it's just the color that was mixed up and it still works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: This one one of the best Xmas gifts for the kids this yr. They love playing tag with them. We are very interested in seeing what else Sphero comes up with
customer_reviews.author: Michael Seeley

customer_reviews.title: Neat gadget
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my daughter to terrorize her cats. The cat loved it and chased it around for hours. Very cool toy, controlled by your phone. A little pricey but I think worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Guyer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: After one month of very little use it won’t even move anymore. Save your money and don’t get this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Must and not expensive fun-gaming- coding devise.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product for early elementary and elements age kids for not only fun and playing games but also to learn how to code. The adults definitely has to sit down for couple of simple projects to o teach kids how to code. The only con is battery life which could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Kinjal

customer_reviews.title: A Xmas present for our cat.
customer_reviews.text: The cat seems perplexed. He stares at it and watches it move about, then suddenly pounces. Maybe a grey one would look more like a mouse. As a beginner programmer tool, it probably works very good. The community donated programmes are either hard to get to, or not very good. Haven't seen anything worth not deleting.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It has even more functions than I originally thought when I ordered it. There are so many things to do with this, and at a pretty good price. It's also nice how customizable they are, I didn't do anything with this shell but I'm planning to order another shell and paint it. Overall, amazing for play and education. I've recommended this to several people.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Sphero is a HIT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Both kids my 5yo & 11yo have really enjoyed it. It's really a fun item and learning to code with the coding blocks makes it easily understandable....great item if you want to get your kids interested in simple coding & robotics
customer_reviews.author: MzBlu4rd

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: The Sphero Mini is a great gift to give and is a pretty good price. The app is easy to use as well as controlling the sphero itself. It is a bummer it is not water proof like the regular Sphero but other than that it is really fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this only to use as a cat toy, ended up having much fun myself too. Varying levels of interaction between 3 cats so I can definitely see it being hit or miss if the cat is interested. Outer casing seems pretty durable and has survived some bumps without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Asurablu

customer_reviews.title: This is the Coolest Thing Ever
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super cool. App works great. Battery life is great. Lasts 3+ days with normal play time. I didn't think this would be as good as it is but I would recommend this to anyone thinking about getting it
customer_reviews.author: David Wagganer

customer_reviews.title: Novelty wears off quick.
customer_reviews.text: It was cool, but little glitchy. You’ll have more fun with a drone for $40. The separating case thing is a problem for small dogs that can and will chase, catch, claim, and destroy if not taken. My cats cared more about... well literally anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan W.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sphero mini for my 9yr old for Christmas and it was a hit! She absolutely loves it and all the cool features the app provides. Definitely a budget friendly investment!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck even on VERY short carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Carpet is so short I use the "bare floor" setting on my vacuum but the ball still gets stuck on it.... works great on the hardwood floor though my cat loves chasing it on the hardwood floor. Will try the bigger ball as it is supposed to have better/stronger and I really want to be able to plat with my cat anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: More fun than a barrel of monkeys and EDUCATIONAL!
customer_reviews.text: We use these at school to teach coding. The kids can be seen in the hallways making their way through mazes. They also create boxes that look like race cars, monsters, etc.and put them over the Sphere and send their creations rolling along.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Jam packed with fun!
customer_reviews.text: It is everything we hoped and my ITT son loved it as well as my grandkids. It lights up, you can change the colors, It is small enough to pack in the hardshell case and kill time almost anyplace. Super cool and worth every penny in entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: He loved it. And I had fun using it to ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my husband a mechanical engineer and pilot's Christmas gift. He loved it. And I had fun using it to chase our dog and entice our cat. It's a great toy, even for adults!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hill

customer_reviews.title: Big hit
customer_reviews.text: This was a big hit with my 10 year old techie granddaughter. She designed several obstacle course and used her coding skills to enhance the moves available.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a novelty, but couldn't get it to work. I asked the IT guy at work about it. He said to return it after trying it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: shoemom

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: Works great, rolls quick, smooth controls, the app functions wonderfully on android. Have 4 cats they love chasing it around, even when i'm not controlling it they continue to play with it. charge time is quick, and lasts a long time
customer_reviews.author: Jose Montero

customer_reviews.title: Its cute
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Its a lot smaller than I imagined. Honestly, not sure it's worth the price but my son loves it. It was a big hit for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 3 worked
customer_reviews.text: The first one (the gifted one) didn’t work, ordered a replacement received 2.... for 1 to work and will return 2. It’s is a fun little ball, about the size of a golf ball and rolls around every where once you get one working
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to charge and set up. Fun to play with. Cat really got a kick out of chasing it up and down the hall. Like how you can alter the color of the lights and the speed. Kids would definitely love playing with this little robot ball.
customer_reviews.author: JudyAS19

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: My son had played with this for hours! We have had no problems with it at all. Holds a charge for a long time. Great toy!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Haines

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift Item
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my brother after I read other reviews. It lived up to expectations and my brother loves it. Packaged really nicely. Wish it came with a small velvet bag to store all the items together.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow8

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Classroom Activity
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my classroom and the kids LOVE it! Great price and reliable. I use it with my amazon tablet and it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Soph1995

customer_reviews.title: Cool and easy robot
customer_reviews.text: Neat little robot. Although my kids haven’t played with it much. It’s a cool little item to gift. Santa brought us the Sphero.
customer_reviews.author: Undying fishy

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, this is a great little mini sphero that's a ton of fun to play with. All kids in the household were enamored!
customer_reviews.author: Boris Gelfand

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Tool
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as a toy for my kitten. I had my 11 yr old great niece program the Sphero mini for me. She enjoyed working with it so much that I gave it to her. It seemed like the battery life did not last long before it had to be plugged in to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan L.

customer_reviews.title: Not programmable
customer_reviews.text: I got the smaller one because I loved the color and size. I did not read the fine print. This one is not programmable like the larger one. My girls did love it and play with it but they now want the larger one too.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Spherotastic
customer_reviews.text: So cool!! Kids love it. You download the app and control the Sphero from there. Has several different games to play on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2

customer_reviews.title: Engaging
customer_reviews.text: Great present for an 8-year-old. He spent many hours figuring it out and playing with it. We are very pleased as he is learning STEM skils through manipulating Sphero. Giving it 4 stars though because it does glitch sometime and goes off course. Otherwise, great investment. We do like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Cool and different.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty fun to pass the time, play with pets, or even for the kids. It's a lot cooler then what I though it was gonna be. It's just that, if you don't have anything to do with it (knock things down, make your dog/cat chase it) you'll get bored kinda fast. If you get a new toy, you'll forget about it quick.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to mess with the dog
customer_reviews.text: The product was as described, and it is very easy to work with your phone and is a blast to mess with the dog or cat with. Rolls well across carpet or hardwood floors and I even bought one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Guyer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my nieces, nephew, and my own kids for Christmas. They have so much fun making obstacles courses and racing them through the house. My SIL text me that my brother had taken it over from his kids and didn’t want to share! It’s a win for all of us and we’ll worth the money,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I mean as a time killer it’s fun to have and super small and portable
customer_reviews.text: Cute tiny and fun just to pull out anywhere especially to prank friends with it’s a cute time killer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my oldest grandson. He really liked it and was excited to learn what all could be done
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun and easy to use! But with so much advancement potential, ( coding, tricks etc) it never need to get boring, only issue I have is that it doesn’t work with the force band
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Yes. It really was great I used it at the steam center and it was so fun I had to get one!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mini RC! Very fun to drive! Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tiny RC device strong enough to go on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Carl and Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves sphero
customer_reviews.text: The mini Sphero works great for fun with my cat. It’s a little hard to control but found out the Sphero edu app controls it better. Nice little gadget to play with.
customer_reviews.author: stephen l burgess

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any age
customer_reviews.text: I bought 10 of these for use in a 9th grade science classroom. These allow you to learn basic coding and beyond. The technology you get for the price cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: j richards

customer_reviews.title: Nice small toy use it for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a gun toy small enough to take anywhere and uses phone for remote I liked this as there is no looking for lost remote
customer_reviews.author: kim hurst

customer_reviews.title: Fun for 8 to 80 years.
customer_reviews.text: These things are a lot of fun. If you got two or three going at once it’s even 2 to 3 times the fun.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reida

customer_reviews.title: An interesting toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a small ball that rolls around on the floor...and you control the rolling from an app on your cell phone. My 7 year old grandson thought it was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Reilley

product_meta.title: Sphero Mini (Blue) App-Enabled Programmable Robot Ball - STEM Educational Toy for Kids Ages 8 & Up - Drive, Game & Code with Sphero Play & Edu App, 1.57"
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueSphero Mini packs tons of fun into a tiny, app-enabled robotic ball. Equipped with a gyroscope, accelerometer, and colorful LED lights, this app-enabled robotic ball lets you drive, play games, and learn to code using our free apps. Control your Mini any way you like with the Sphero Play app. Included with Sphero Mini are 3 traffic cones and 6 bowling pins to inspire obstacle course fun right out of the box. Or use Mini as a game controller for arcade-style games, perfect for playing on-the-go or with limited space. Use the Blocks drive mode to give your Mini basic drag and drop coding commands, or download the Sphero Edu app for more ways to program your educational bot, including JavaScript and Swift. Drive, game, code—Sphero Mini is the next big thing.

SET CONTAINS:
Sphero Mini, USB Charger, Set of Cones, Set of Bowling Pins
feature_bullets: LITTLE ROBOT, LOTTA FUN: Sphero Mini packs a ton of fun into a tiny programmable robot the size of a ping pong ball. Equipped with a gyroscope, accelerometer, and colorful LED lights, this app-enabled robotic ball lets you drive, play games, and code using our free apps.

DRIVE MODE: Control your robot toy any way you like with the Sphero Play app. Drag and drive with Joystick mode, pull back and release with Slingshot mode or tip and rotate your mobile device with Tilt mode. Included with Sphero Mini are 3 traffic cones and 6 bowling pins to inspire obstacle course fun right out of the box.

PLAY GAMES: Use Sphero Mini as a game controller for arcade-style games in the Sphero Play app. Perfect for playing on the go or with limited space. Choose from 3 different games - shoot through space, speed through a tunnel, or smash a polygon of bricks. With 1 hour of play time, Sphero Mini is the next big thing.

LEARN TO CODE: Use the Blocks drive mode to give your coding robot basic drag and drop coding commands. Looking for more of a challenge? Download the Sphero Edu app for more ways to program your educational bot, including JavaScript and Swift.

INSPIRING THE CREATORS OF TOMORROW: Founded in 2010, we set out to redefine creative play experiences with the original Sphero app-enabled robot ball. Now, with our undeniably cool fleet of programmable robots and educational tools, we're inspiring a new generation through hands-on applied learning of coding, science, music and the arts.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
